{"compiler":{"version":"0.8.20+commit.a1b79de6"},"language":"Solidity","output":{"abi":[{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_sliqIDRegistry","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"_fxOracle","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"constructor"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"internalType":"string","name":"fromSliqId","type":"string"},{"indexed":true,"internalType":"string","name":"toSliqId","type":"string"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"address","name":"fromToken","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"address","name":"toToken","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"fromAmount","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"toAmount","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"rate","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"timestamp","type":"uint256"}],"name":"AssetConverted","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"internalType":"string","name":"sliqId","type":"string"},{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"newBalance","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"timestamp","type":"uint256"}],"name":"BalanceUpdated","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"operator","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"timestamp","type":"uint256"}],"name":"OperatorAdded","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"operator","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"timestamp","type":"uint256"}],"name":"OperatorRemoved","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"newOracle","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"timestamp","type":"uint256"}],"name":"OracleUpdated","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"timestamp","type":"uint256"}],"name":"Paused","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"sender","type":"address"},{"indexed":true,"internalType":"string","name":"recipientSliqId","type":"string"},{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"timestamp","type":"uint256"}],"name":"PaymentRouted","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"newRegistry","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"timestamp","type":"uint256"}],"name":"RegistryUpdated","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"timestamp","type":"uint256"}],"name":"Unpaused","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"to","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"timestamp","type":"uint256"}],"name":"Withdrawn","type":"event"},{"inputs":[],"name":"NATIVE_TOKEN","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"operator","type":"address"}],"name":"addOperator","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"string","name":"fromSliqId","type":"string"},{"internalType":"string","name":"toSliqId","type":"string"},{"internalType":"address","name":"fromToken","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"toToken","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"convertAsset","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"fxOracle","outputs":[{"internalType":"contract IMockFxOracle","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"string","name":"sliqId","type":"string"},{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"}],"name":"getBalance","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"balance","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"string","name":"sliqId","type":"string"},{"internalType":"address[]","name":"tokens","type":"address[]"}],"name":"getBalances","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256[]","name":"balances","type":"uint256[]"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"account","type":"address"}],"name":"isOperator","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"name":"operators","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"owner","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"pause","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"paused","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"operator","type":"address"}],"name":"removeOperator","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"string","name":"recipientSliqId","type":"string"},{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"routePayment","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"string","name":"recipientSliqId","type":"string"}],"name":"routePaymentNative","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"newOracle","type":"address"}],"name":"setFxOracle","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"newRegistry","type":"address"}],"name":"setSliqIDRegistry","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"string","name":"","type":"string"},{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"name":"sliqBalances","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"sliqIDRegistry","outputs":[{"internalType":"contract ISliqIDRegistry","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"newOwner","type":"address"}],"name":"transferOwnership","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"unpause","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"address","name":"to","type":"address"}],"name":"withdraw","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"address payable","name":"to","type":"address"}],"name":"withdrawNative","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"stateMutability":"payable","type":"receive"}],"devdoc":{"events":{"AssetConverted(string,string,address,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Important for:      - Tracking conversion history      - Verifying rate accuracy      - Detecting suspicious conversions      - Compliance and reporting","params":{"fromAmount":"The amount of source tokens converted","fromSliqId":"The SliqID whose tokens are being converted (sender)","fromToken":"The source token address","rate":"The conversion rate used (from Oracle)","timestamp":"The block timestamp of the conversion","toAmount":"The amount of destination tokens received","toSliqId":"The SliqID receiving the converted tokens (receiver)","toToken":"The destination token address"}},"BalanceUpdated(string,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Used for:      - Real-time balance updates in frontend      - Audit trail of all balance changes      - Analytics and reporting","params":{"newBalance":"The updated balance after the operation","sliqId":"The SliqID whose balance changed","timestamp":"The block timestamp of the update","token":"The token address"}},"OperatorAdded(address,uint256)":{"params":{"operator":"The address granted operator privileges","timestamp":"The block timestamp"}},"OperatorRemoved(address,uint256)":{"params":{"operator":"The address whose operator privileges were revoked","timestamp":"The block timestamp"}},"OracleUpdated(address,uint256)":{"params":{"newOracle":"The new oracle address","timestamp":"The block timestamp"}},"Paused(uint256)":{"params":{"timestamp":"The block timestamp"}},"PaymentRouted(address,string,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Backend listens to this event to:      - Update database with transaction      - Notify recipient of incoming payment      - Update dashboard balance displays      - Generate transaction receipts","params":{"amount":"The amount transferred (in token's smallest unit)","recipientSliqId":"The SliqID receiving the payment","sender":"The address that initiated the payment","timestamp":"The block timestamp of the transaction","token":"The token address (address(0) for native token)"}},"RegistryUpdated(address,uint256)":{"params":{"newRegistry":"The new registry address","timestamp":"The block timestamp"}},"Unpaused(uint256)":{"params":{"timestamp":"The block timestamp"}},"Withdrawn(address,uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"Critical for:      - Audit trail of fund movements      - Detecting unauthorized withdrawals      - Settlement tracking","params":{"amount":"The amount withdrawn","timestamp":"The block timestamp of the withdrawal","to":"The address receiving the withdrawal","token":"The token withdrawn (address(0) for native)"}}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"addOperator(address)":{"custom:emits":"OperatorAdded","details":"Owner-only function for operator management Operators can: - Call convertAsset() Operators cannot: - Pause/unpause - Withdraw funds - Add/remove other operators - Change configuration","params":{"operator":"The address to grant operator privileges"}},"constructor":{"details":"Sets up contract with registry and oracle addresses","params":{"_fxOracle":"Address of the FX Oracle contract (can be address(0) if not using conversions) Requirements: - _sliqIDRegistry must not be zero address (critical dependency) - Deployer becomes the owner - Contract starts unpaused Post-deployment: 1. Register initial SliqIDs in the registry 2. Configure token rates in the oracle 3. Add operators if needed 4. Test with small amounts first Example deployment: ```javascript const registry = await SliqIDRegistry.deploy(); const oracle = await MockFxOracle.deploy(); const vault = await TreasuryVault.deploy(registry.address, oracle.address); ```","_sliqIDRegistry":"Address of the SliqID Registry contract"}},"convertAsset(string,string,address,address,uint256)":{"custom:emits":"AssetConvertedBalanceUpdated (twice)","details":"Operator-only function for facilitating cross-asset payments Use Cases: 1. User wants to send USDT but recipient prefers USDC 2. Automatic conversion for better liquidity 3. Cross-token payment routing Flow: 1. Validate both SliqIDs exist 2. Check sender has sufficient fromToken balance 3. Get conversion rate from Oracle 4. Calculate converted amount 5. Atomically debit sender and credit receiver 6. Emit event for tracking","params":{"amount":"The amount of source tokens to convert Requirements: - Contract must not be paused - Caller must be operator or owner - Both SliqIDs must be registered - fromSliqId must have sufficient balance - Both tokens must be supported by Oracle - FX Oracle must be configured (not address(0)) Effects: - Debits fromSliqId's fromToken balance - Credits toSliqId's toToken balance (converted amount) - Emits AssetConverted event - Emits two BalanceUpdated events Example: ```solidity // alice has 1000 USDT, wants to send 100 USDT worth of USDC to bob // Oracle rates: USDT = 1500 NGN, USDC = 1500 NGN (1:1 conversion) vault.convertAsset(\"\\alice\", \"\\bob\", usdtAddr, usdcAddr, 100 * 10**6); // Result: // alice USDT: 900 * 10**6 (1000 - 100) // bob USDC: +100 * 10**6 (100 USDC equivalent) ``` Example with different rates: ```solidity // Oracle rates: USDT = 1500 NGN, DAI = 1485 NGN (DAI slightly depegged) // Converting 100 USDT to DAI vault.convertAsset(\"\\alice\", \"\\bob\", usdtAddr, daiAddr, 100 * 10**18); // Conversion: (100 * 1500) / 1485 \u2248 101.01 DAI // alice USDT: -100 // bob DAI: +101.01 (gets more DAI due to depeg) ``` Security: - Only operators can call (prevents unauthorized conversions) - Atomic operation (both updates succeed or both fail) - Protected by nonReentrant - Oracle rate validation Production Considerations: - Monitor operator activity for abuse - Implement conversion limits - Add slippage protection - Consider decimal normalization for different token decimals","fromSliqId":"The SliqID whose tokens are being converted","fromToken":"The source token address","toSliqId":"The SliqID receiving the converted tokens","toToken":"The destination token address"}},"getBalance(string,address)":{"details":"Public view function for balance queries","params":{"sliqId":"The SliqID to query","token":"The token address (address(0) for native)"},"returns":{"balance":"The current balance Returns 0 if: - SliqID has never received this token - SliqID's balance has been fully withdrawn/converted Example Usage: ```solidity // Get alice's USDT balance uint256 usdtBalance = vault.getBalance(\"\\alice\", usdtAddress); // Get bob's native token balance uint256 ethBalance = vault.getBalance(\"\\bob\", address(0)); ``` Frontend Integration: - Call this for each supported token - Format based on token decimals - Convert to fiat using Oracle rates for display"}},"getBalances(string,address[])":{"details":"Gas-efficient way to query multiple balances","params":{"sliqId":"The SliqID to query","tokens":"Array of token addresses to query"},"returns":{"balances":"Array of corresponding balances Why batch query? - Reduces number of RPC calls (important for UX) - More efficient than multiple individual calls - Better for dashboard displays showing all assets Example Usage: ```solidity address[] memory tokens = new address[](3); tokens[0] = usdtAddress; tokens[1] = usdcAddress; tokens[2] = address(0);  // Native token uint256[] memory balances = vault.getBalances(\"\\alice\", tokens); // balances[0] = USDT balance // balances[1] = USDC balance // balances[2] = Native token balance ``` Frontend Dashboard: ```javascript const tokens = [USDT_ADDR, USDC_ADDR, DAI_ADDR, NATIVE]; const balances = await vault.getBalances(\"\\alice\", tokens); // Display all balances in single UI render balances.forEach((bal, i) => {   console.log(`${tokenNames[i]}: ${formatBalance(bal, decimals[i])}`); }); ```"}},"isOperator(address)":{"details":"Public view function for operator status checks","params":{"account":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"isOperator True if the address is an operator or owner Note: Owner is implicitly an operator"}},"pause()":{"custom:emits":"Paused","details":"Owner-only emergency function When to pause? - Security vulnerability discovered - Oracle malfunction or manipulation - Suspicious activity detected - Planned maintenance or upgrades What gets paused? - routePayment() - routePaymentNative() - convertAsset() What still works? - Admin functions (withdraw, unpause, config) - View functions (getBalance, etc.)"},"removeOperator(address)":{"custom:emits":"OperatorRemoved","details":"Owner-only function for operator management","params":{"operator":"The address to revoke operator privileges from"}},"routePayment(string,address,uint256)":{"custom:emits":"PaymentRoutedBalanceUpdated","details":"Primary entry point for ERC20 token payments Flow: 1. Validate inputs (amount > 0, recipient exists) 2. Transfer tokens from sender to this contract 3. Credit recipient's internal ledger 4. Emit events for tracking","params":{"amount":"The amount to transfer (in token's smallest unit) Requirements: - Contract must not be paused - Amount must be greater than 0 - Recipient SliqID must be registered - Caller must have approved this contract for >= amount - Token contract must successfully execute transferFrom Effects: - Transfers tokens from msg.sender to this contract - Credits recipient's ledger: sliqBalances[recipientSliqId][token] += amount - Emits PaymentRouted event - Emits BalanceUpdated event Example Usage: ```solidity // 1. User approves TreasuryVault usdt.approve(treasuryVaultAddress, 1000 * 10**6); // 2. User routes payment to bob treasuryVault.routePayment(\"\\bob\", usdtAddress, 1000 * 10**6); // 3. bob's balance increases // sliqBalances[\"\\bob\"][usdt] = 1000 * 10**6 ``` Security: - Protected by nonReentrant to prevent reentrancy attacks - Protected by whenNotPaused for emergency stops - Validates recipient exists before transfer (prevents lost funds)","recipientSliqId":"The SliqID to receive payment (e.g., \"\\maryam\")","token":"The ERC20 token contract address"}},"routePaymentNative(string)":{"custom:emits":"PaymentRoutedBalanceUpdated","details":"Specialized function for native token transfers Flow: 1. Validate msg.value > 0 2. Validate recipient exists 3. Credit recipient's internal ledger (using address(0) as token identifier) 4. Emit events for tracking","params":{"recipientSliqId":"The SliqID to receive payment (e.g., \"\\alice\") Requirements: - Contract must not be paused - msg.value must be greater than 0 - Recipient SliqID must be registered Effects: - Receives native tokens (automatically via payable) - Credits recipient's ledger: sliqBalances[recipientSliqId][address(0)] += msg.value - Emits PaymentRouted event - Emits BalanceUpdated event Example Usage: ```solidity // Send 1 ETH to charlie treasuryVault.routePaymentNative{value: 1 ether}(\"\\charlie\"); // charlie's native token balance increases // sliqBalances[\"\\charlie\"][address(0)] = 1 ether ``` Why separate function for native tokens? - Native tokens don't require approval - No need for transferFrom call - Cleaner separation of concerns - Better gas efficiency for native transfers Security: - Protected by nonReentrant to prevent reentrancy attacks - Protected by whenNotPaused for emergency stops - Validates recipient exists before accepting payment"}},"setFxOracle(address)":{"custom:emits":"OracleUpdated","details":"Owner-only function for configuration updates Use Cases: - Oracle contract upgrade - Switch to production oracle (Chainlink) - Bug fix in oracle","params":{"newOracle":"The new oracle contract address Note: Can be set to address(0) to disable conversions Requirements: - Only callable by owner"}},"setSliqIDRegistry(address)":{"custom:emits":"RegistryUpdated","details":"Owner-only function for configuration updates Use Cases: - Registry contract upgrade - Bug fix in registry - Migration to new registry version","params":{"newRegistry":"The new registry contract address Requirements: - Only callable by owner - New registry must not be zero address Caution: - Ensure new registry is compatible - Test thoroughly before switching - Consider pausing during switch"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Owner-only function for ownership transfer","params":{"newOwner":"The address of the new owner Requirements: - Only callable by current owner - New owner must not be zero address Production: - Consider two-step transfer (propose + accept) - Use multi-sig for ownership"}},"unpause()":{"custom:emits":"Unpaused","details":"Owner-only function Before unpausing, ensure: - Security issue resolved - Oracle functioning correctly - All systems operational - Tested on testnet if applicable"},"withdraw(address,uint256,address)":{"custom:emits":"Withdrawn","details":"Owner-only function for settlement or emergency withdrawals Use Cases: - Settle with service providers (VTPass, etc.) - Move funds to cold storage - Emergency fund recovery - Liquidity management","params":{"amount":"The amount to withdraw","to":"The address to receive the withdrawal Requirements: - Only callable by owner - Contract must have sufficient token balance - to address must not be zero Effects: - Transfers tokens from contract to specified address - Emits Withdrawn event Security: - Owner-only access - Balance check before transfer - Event emission for audit trail Production: - Consider multi-sig requirement - Implement withdrawal limits - Add time-locks for large amounts","token":"The token address to withdraw"}},"withdrawNative(uint256,address)":{"custom:emits":"Withdrawn","details":"Owner-only function for native token withdrawals","params":{"amount":"The amount to withdraw","to":"The address to receive the withdrawal Requirements: - Only callable by owner - Contract must have sufficient native token balance - to address must not be zero Effects: - Transfers native tokens from contract to specified address - Emits Withdrawn event Security: - Owner-only access - Balance check before transfer - Uses call for safe transfer - Protected by nonReentrant"}}},"stateVariables":{"NATIVE_TOKEN":{"details":"Represents the native token (ETH on Ethereum, GLMR on Moonbeam) Using address(0) as a sentinel value to distinguish native vs ERC20 tokens"},"_locked":{"details":"Reentrancy guard - prevents recursive calls"},"fxOracle":{"details":"Used for cross-asset conversions (e.g., USDT -> USDC)      In production, this would be Chainlink Price Feed or similar"},"operators":{"details":"Operators can call convertAsset() but not admin functions      This allows backend to facilitate conversions without full control      Owner is implicitly an operator"},"owner":{"details":"Can pause/unpause, withdraw funds, update config, manage operators      In production, this should be a multi-sig or DAO"},"paused":{"details":"When true, all payment and conversion operations are blocked      Admin functions (withdraw, unpause) still work      Used for security incidents, oracle failures, or maintenance"},"sliqBalances":{"details":"Mapping structure: SliqID => Token Address => Balance Example state: sliqBalances[\"\\alice\"][USDT_ADDRESS] = 1000 * 10^6  (1000 USDT) sliqBalances[\"\\alice\"][address(0)] = 2 * 10^18     (2 ETH) sliqBalances[\"\\bob\"][USDC_ADDRESS] = 500 * 10^6    (500 USDC) Why this structure? - O(1) lookup for any SliqID + token combination - Supports unlimited tokens without contract modification - Gas-efficient compared to array iteration - Easy to audit and verify balances"},"sliqIDRegistry":{"details":"Used to validate and resolve SliqIDs to wallet addresses      All payment routing depends on this registry being accurate"}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"AssetConverted(string,string,address,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when assets are converted between tokens"},"BalanceUpdated(string,address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a user's balance is updated (credit or debit)"},"OperatorAdded(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when an operator is added"},"OperatorRemoved(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when an operator is removed"},"OracleUpdated(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when the FX Oracle address is updated"},"Paused(uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when contract is paused"},"PaymentRouted(address,string,address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a payment is successfully routed to a SliqID"},"RegistryUpdated(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when the SliqID Registry address is updated"},"Unpaused(uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when contract is unpaused"},"Withdrawn(address,uint256,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when admin withdraws funds from the contract"}},"kind":"user","methods":{"addOperator(address)":{"notice":"Adds a new operator"},"constructor":{"notice":"Initializes the TreasuryVault with required dependencies"},"convertAsset(string,string,address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Converts assets from one token to another between two SliqIDs"},"fxOracle()":{"notice":"Reference to the FX Oracle for conversion rates"},"getBalance(string,address)":{"notice":"Gets the balance of a SliqID for a specific token"},"getBalances(string,address[])":{"notice":"Gets balances for multiple tokens at once (batch query)"},"isOperator(address)":{"notice":"Checks if an address is an operator"},"operators(address)":{"notice":"Operator addresses authorized for conversion operations"},"owner()":{"notice":"Contract owner with full admin privileges"},"pause()":{"notice":"Pauses all payment and conversion operations"},"paused()":{"notice":"Emergency pause flag"},"removeOperator(address)":{"notice":"Removes an operator"},"routePayment(string,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Routes an ERC20 token payment to a recipient's SliqID"},"routePaymentNative(string)":{"notice":"Routes a native token (ETH/GLMR) payment to a recipient's SliqID"},"setFxOracle(address)":{"notice":"Updates the FX Oracle address"},"setSliqIDRegistry(address)":{"notice":"Updates the SliqID Registry address"},"sliqBalances(string,address)":{"notice":"Multi-token ledger tracking balances for each SliqID"},"sliqIDRegistry()":{"notice":"Reference to the SliqID Registry for identity resolution"},"transferOwnership(address)":{"notice":"Transfers ownership to a new address"},"unpause()":{"notice":"Resumes all operations after emergency pause"},"withdraw(address,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Withdraws ERC20 tokens from the contract"},"withdrawNative(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Withdraws native tokens (ETH/GLMR) from the contract"}},"version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"contracts/TreasuryVault.sol":"TreasuryVault"},"evmVersion":"paris","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[":forge-std/=lib/forge-std/src/"]},"sources":{"contracts/TreasuryVault.sol":{"keccak256":"0x2f6bb3b47ac9e1e524cf48f71558b4add84dcc88036ddc1be6ed3844085af2d0","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f79ee2efac6c02267a6395e0a5308abffca96ff4856ede56979fd9a980897f40","dweb:/ipfs/QmSHnLKFeD2LE5kUGrDVcZugBqM8niCSMr2rr8Mx6WfLXh"]},"contracts/interfaces/IMockFxOracle.sol":{"keccak256":"0x52213decfd79044bbe1240e2518a836c7ad4ddc1f7dff9cd795a5dd67e7876c5","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://e90042f66124ee96294138381e081070877145f723c7dd6ec7675da2585aed1e","dweb:/ipfs/QmSoPuqRK9XSMuPxUSg1nvWoK14rDKTgdS4ZwwQCZPoN6C"]},"contracts/interfaces/ISliqIDRegistry.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf25abf37ecbc0d2edc7c009c7ca2bdafab111b69d6bdb410b3237a898799b0a4","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://4290500cd330f70a5fe05ec42bc57d4e2dc3a2eccbf91ce9c16ec25f0a5d05cd","dweb:/ipfs/QmZ2icFcbzbVed8riviHETRKozL9KPwXn1wUxoNbs9dBm3"]}},"version":1}

addOperator(address).details: Owner-only function for operator management Operators can: - Call convertAsset() Operators cannot: - Pause/unpause - Withdraw funds - Add/remove other operators - Change configuration

params.operator: The address to grant operator privileges

constructor.details: Sets up contract with registry and oracle addresses

params._fxOracle: Address of the FX Oracle contract (can be address(0) if not using conversions) Requirements: - _sliqIDRegistry must not be zero address (critical dependency) - Deployer becomes the owner - Contract starts unpaused Post-deployment: 1. Register initial SliqIDs in the registry 2. Configure token rates in the oracle 3. Add operators if needed 4. Test with small amounts first Example deployment: ```javascript const registry = await SliqIDRegistry.deploy(); const oracle = await MockFxOracle.deploy(); const vault = await TreasuryVault.deploy(registry.address, oracle.address); ```
params._sliqIDRegistry: Address of the SliqID Registry contract

convertAsset(string,string,address,addre.details: Operator-only function for facilitating cross-asset payments Use Cases: 1. User wants to send USDT but recipient prefers USDC 2. Automatic conversion for better liquidity 3. Cross-token payment routing Flow: 1. Validate both SliqIDs exist 2. Check sender has sufficient fromToken balance 3. Get conversion rate from Oracle 4. Calculate converted amount 5. Atomically debit sender and credit receiver 6. Emit event for tracking

params.amount: The amount of source tokens to convert Requirements: - Contract must not be paused - Caller must be operator or owner - Both SliqIDs must be registered - fromSliqId must have sufficient balance - Both tokens must be supported by Oracle - FX Oracle must be configured (not address(0)) Effects: - Debits fromSliqId's fromToken balance - Credits toSliqId's toToken balance (converted amount) - Emits AssetConverted event - Emits two BalanceUpdated events Example: ```solidity // alice has 1000 USDT, wants to send 100 USDT worth of USDC to bob // Oracle rates: USDT = 1500 NGN, USDC = 1500 NGN (1:1 conversion) vault.convertAsset("\alice", "\bob", usdtAddr, usdcAddr, 100 * 10**6); // Result: // alice USDT: 900 * 10**6 (1000 - 100) // bob USDC: +100 * 10**6 (100 USDC equivalent) ``` Example with different rates: ```solidity // Oracle rates: USDT = 1500 NGN, DAI = 1485 NGN (DAI slightly depegged) // Converting 100 USDT to DAI vault.convertAsset("\alice", "\bob", usdtAddr, daiAddr, 100 * 10**18); // Conversion: (100 * 1500) / 1485  101.01 DAI // alice USDT: -100 // bob DAI: +101.01 (gets more DAI due to depeg) ``` Security: - Only operators can call (prevents unauthorized conversions) - Atomic operation (both updates succeed or both fail) - Protected by nonReentrant - Oracle rate validation Production Considerations: - Monitor operator activity for abuse - Implement conversion limits - Add slippage protection - Consider decimal normalization for different token decimals
params.fromSliqId: The SliqID whose tokens are being converted
params.toSliqId: The SliqID receiving the converted tokens

getBalance(string,address).details: Public view function for balance queries

returns.balance: The current balance Returns 0 if: - SliqID has never received this token - SliqID's balance has been fully withdrawn/converted Example Usage: ```solidity // Get alice's USDT balance uint256 usdtBalance = vault.getBalance("\alice", usdtAddress); // Get bob's native token balance uint256 ethBalance = vault.getBalance("\bob", address(0)); ``` Frontend Integration: - Call this for each supported token - Format based on token decimals - Convert to fiat using Oracle rates for display

getBalances(string,address[]).details: Gas-efficient way to query multiple balances

params.tokens: Array of token addresses to query

returns.balances: Array of corresponding balances Why batch query? - Reduces number of RPC calls (important for UX) - More efficient than multiple individual calls - Better for dashboard displays showing all assets Example Usage: ```solidity address[] memory tokens = new address[](3); tokens[0] = usdtAddress; tokens[1] = usdcAddress; tokens[2] = address(0);  // Native token uint256[] memory balances = vault.getBalances("\alice", tokens); // balances[0] = USDT balance // balances[1] = USDC balance // balances[2] = Native token balance ``` Frontend Dashboard: ```javascript const tokens = [USDT_ADDR, USDC_ADDR, DAI_ADDR, NATIVE]; const balances = await vault.getBalances("\alice", tokens); // Display all balances in single UI render balances.forEach((bal, i) => {   console.log(`${tokenNames[i]}: ${formatBalance(bal, decimals[i])}`); }); ```

isOperator(address).details: Public view function for operator status checks

returns._0: isOperator True if the address is an operator or owner Note: Owner is implicitly an operator

pause().details: Owner-only emergency function When to pause? - Security vulnerability discovered - Oracle malfunction or manipulation - Suspicious activity detected - Planned maintenance or upgrades What gets paused? - routePayment() - routePaymentNative() - convertAsset() What still works? - Admin functions (withdraw, unpause, config) - View functions (getBalance, etc.)

params.operator: The address to revoke operator privileges from

routePayment(string,address,uint256).details: Primary entry point for ERC20 token payments Flow: 1. Validate inputs (amount > 0, recipient exists) 2. Transfer tokens from sender to this contract 3. Credit recipient's internal ledger 4. Emit events for tracking

params.amount: The amount to transfer (in token's smallest unit) Requirements: - Contract must not be paused - Amount must be greater than 0 - Recipient SliqID must be registered - Caller must have approved this contract for >= amount - Token contract must successfully execute transferFrom Effects: - Transfers tokens from msg.sender to this contract - Credits recipient's ledger: sliqBalances[recipientSliqId][token] += amount - Emits PaymentRouted event - Emits BalanceUpdated event Example Usage: ```solidity // 1. User approves TreasuryVault usdt.approve(treasuryVaultAddress, 1000 * 10**6); // 2. User routes payment to bob treasuryVault.routePayment("\bob", usdtAddress, 1000 * 10**6); // 3. bob's balance increases // sliqBalances["\bob"][usdt] = 1000 * 10**6 ``` Security: - Protected by nonReentrant to prevent reentrancy attacks - Protected by whenNotPaused for emergency stops - Validates recipient exists before transfer (prevents lost funds)

routePaymentNative(string).details: Specialized function for native token transfers Flow: 1. Validate msg.value > 0 2. Validate recipient exists 3. Credit recipient's internal ledger (using address(0) as token identifier) 4. Emit events for tracking

params.recipientSliqId: The SliqID to receive payment (e.g., "\alice") Requirements: - Contract must not be paused - msg.value must be greater than 0 - Recipient SliqID must be registered Effects: - Receives native tokens (automatically via payable) - Credits recipient's ledger: sliqBalances[recipientSliqId][address(0)] += msg.value - Emits PaymentRouted event - Emits BalanceUpdated event Example Usage: ```solidity // Send 1 ETH to charlie treasuryVault.routePaymentNative{value: 1 ether}("\charlie"); // charlie's native token balance increases // sliqBalances["\charlie"][address(0)] = 1 ether ``` Why separate function for native tokens? - Native tokens don't require approval - No need for transferFrom call - Cleaner separation of concerns - Better gas efficiency for native transfers Security: - Protected by nonReentrant to prevent reentrancy attacks - Protected by whenNotPaused for emergency stops - Validates recipient exists before accepting payment

setFxOracle(address).details: Owner-only function for configuration updates Use Cases: - Oracle contract upgrade - Switch to production oracle (Chainlink) - Bug fix in oracle

params.newOracle: The new oracle contract address Note: Can be set to address(0) to disable conversions Requirements: - Only callable by owner

setSliqIDRegistry(address).details: Owner-only function for configuration updates Use Cases: - Registry contract upgrade - Bug fix in registry - Migration to new registry version

params.newRegistry: The new registry contract address Requirements: - Only callable by owner - New registry must not be zero address Caution: - Ensure new registry is compatible - Test thoroughly before switching - Consider pausing during switch

params.newOwner: The address of the new owner Requirements: - Only callable by current owner - New owner must not be zero address Production: - Consider two-step transfer (propose + accept) - Use multi-sig for ownership

unpause().details: Owner-only function Before unpausing, ensure: - Security issue resolved - Oracle functioning correctly - All systems operational - Tested on testnet if applicable

withdraw(address,uint256,address).details: Owner-only function for settlement or emergency withdrawals Use Cases: - Settle with service providers (VTPass, etc.) - Move funds to cold storage - Emergency fund recovery - Liquidity management

params.to: The address to receive the withdrawal Requirements: - Only callable by owner - Contract must have sufficient token balance - to address must not be zero Effects: - Transfers tokens from contract to specified address - Emits Withdrawn event Security: - Owner-only access - Balance check before transfer - Event emission for audit trail Production: - Consider multi-sig requirement - Implement withdrawal limits - Add time-locks for large amounts

withdrawNative(uint256,address).details: Owner-only function for native token withdrawals

params.to: The address to receive the withdrawal Requirements: - Only callable by owner - Contract must have sufficient native token balance - to address must not be zero Effects: - Transfers native tokens from contract to specified address - Emits Withdrawn event Security: - Owner-only access - Balance check before transfer - Uses call for safe transfer - Protected by nonReentrant

constructor.notice: Initializes the TreasuryVault with required dependencies

convertAsset(string,string,address,addre.notice: Converts assets from one token to another between two SliqIDs

fxOracle().notice: Reference to the FX Oracle for conversion rates

getBalance(string,address).notice: Gets the balance of a SliqID for a specific token

getBalances(string,address[]).notice: Gets balances for multiple tokens at once (batch query)

isOperator(address).notice: Checks if an address is an operator

operators(address).notice: Operator addresses authorized for conversion operations

owner().notice: Contract owner with full admin privileges

pause().notice: Pauses all payment and conversion operations

routePayment(string,address,uint256).notice: Routes an ERC20 token payment to a recipient's SliqID

routePaymentNative(string).notice: Routes a native token (ETH/GLMR) payment to a recipient's SliqID

sliqBalances(string,address).notice: Multi-token ledger tracking balances for each SliqID

sliqIDRegistry().notice: Reference to the SliqID Registry for identity resolution

transferOwnership(address).notice: Transfers ownership to a new address

unpause().notice: Resumes all operations after emergency pause

withdraw(address,uint256,address).notice: Withdraws ERC20 tokens from the contract

withdrawNative(uint256,address).notice: Withdraws native tokens (ETH/GLMR) from the contract
